channel.title: [PI] Need help adding Chaotics [PI]
channel.description:
Yo,
I want to add Chaotics to my 317 Project Insanity server, But I don't exactly know how. Tried several things, like adding code to ItemDef.java and adding .DAT's to the cache or something. But nothing really happens.
I am using this Source and Client: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=508325.0
I have worked with this source and client 85% of the time, cause I understand quite some things and I find it organized.
Yes, I have posted this before but then in the Wrong Section (By accident), so this time It's in the right section.
It would be awesome if anyone could explain me what to do. I know you need .DAT files and Ints but I'm not sure where to put them, only thing I know is that .DAT's are client sided.. And I heard about Class8.java but I don't have that. I do have ItemDef.java.
Any help is appreciated.

item.title: [PI] Need help adding Chaotics [PI]
item.dc:creator: @97_emerald 97 emerald
item.description:
@97_emerald wrote:

PI servers its under cache>raw paste the dat files there

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need help adding Chaotics [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

Derpington! This is perfect, I’m adding chaotics to mine also I am starting with the same base as you are, and I have improved it a lot, barb agil, gnome agil, and im trying to add 474 anims/gfx mind if I pm you?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need help adding Chaotics [PI]
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Derpington, post:2, topic:433140”]Well I have another PI I downloaded from the downloads section to see If i can understand what they have, and I don’t. I’ve looked in their ItemDef.java but I can’t find anything related to a chaotic rapier… Like when i search the item id and such… The problem is, I could probably copy all of it but I don’t want all their stuffs, just the chaotics and some bosses(that comes later…).

Isn’t there some step-by-step guide on how to add such higher version items?[/quote]

Search ALL of the source files. Sometimes there are multiple classes for item declaration.

You are going to have to convert higher revision items.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need help adding Chaotics [PI]
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

I’d say it’s probably in the place with other dat files. I haven’t tried PI, but try that first.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need help adding Chaotics [PI]
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

ItemDef and Class8 are the same, except variable names are different and such. PI clients use ItemDef type vars, where most vars would have actual names, and not names such as anInt200, etc. The dat files should belong in your models folder.

This should help if you are converting models:

NOTE: This is NOT exact, rather my own client’s variable names.

/** class8.aStringArray189 = => itemdata.actions = class8.aStringArray189[1] = => itemdata.actions[1] = class8.anInt190 = => itemdata.modelRotation1 = class8.anInt198 = => itemdata.modelRotation2 = class8.anInt181 = => itemdata.modelZoom = class8.anInt169 = => itemdata.modelOffset1 = class8.aByteArray178 = => itemdata.examineText = class8.aString170 = => itemdata.name = class8.aBoolean176 = => itemdata.stackable = class8.anInt165 = => itemdata.maleEquip1 = class8.anInt200 = => itemdata.femaleEquip1 = class8.anInt204 = => itemdata.anInt204 = class8.anInt175 = => itemdata.anInt175 = class8.anInt197 = => itemdata.anInt197 = class8.anIntArray156 = => itemdata.originalModelColors = class8.anIntArray160 = => itemdata.modifiedModelColors = class8.anInt164 = => itemdata.maleEquip2 = class8.anInt188 = => itemdata.femaleEquip2 = class8.anInt194 = => itemdata.modelOffset2 = class8.anInt174 = => itemdata.dropModel = class8.anInt199 = => itemdata.noteable 
 **/</blockquote>

Read full topic
